edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class Utility

java.lang.Object
  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.Utility

public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a number of static utiilty functions. For example, this includes a random number generator, an array summation method, methods for searching arrays for nonzero values, and methods for packing/unpacking colors into ints.

Lots of these are useful for the Processing version of the CometsRunPane, but we'll see how much longer that's an issue.

I guess you could use your own random number generator, but the RNG used here is static, so it's the only one used in any given instance of the program, so it's more likely to have values coming from a random stream.

Author:
Bill Riehl

pColor

public static int pColor(int r,
                         int g,
                         int b)
Generates a Processing-style 32 bit int version of a color by bit-shifting the rgb values together. If any channel color is out of the [0,255] bounds, it is automatically adjusted to fit.

Parameters:
r - - the value of the red channel, between 0 and 255
g - - the value of the green channel, between 0 and 255
b - - the value of the blue channel, between 0 and 255
Returns:
packed 32-bit int version of a color

Returns:
true if arr has at least one nonzero value

hasMultipleNonzeroValues

public static boolean hasMultipleNonzeroValues(double[] arr)
Similar to hasNonzeroValue(double[]), this searches the array for nonzero values, but only returns true if there are at least 2 nonzero values.

Parameters:
arr - - an array of numbers
Returns:
true if arr has at least two nonzero values
